availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, merchant. Fleming County native. Married to Amelia A. Hinton Kidwell on August 25, 1853. Father of Charles Kidwell, Mary Hattie Kidwell, William B. Kidwell, James Kidwell, and Bettie Kidwell. Teacher in Fleming County in 1850. Merchant in Fleming County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 334. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 10. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 2. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910) Fleming County, Marriages, 1853, Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
